vobaulary.definition: a collection of statements, all but one of which is intended to supply supportor evidence to the remaining statements.
of an argument are the statements in it that are intended to provide support for the remaining statement.
the statement in it for which the other statements are intended to provide support.
the two classical are true and false.
if and only if things are the way the statement says that they are.
if and only if things are NOT the way the statement says that they are.
if and onlu if it is absolutely impossible for all of it's premises to be true, while it's confluded to be false.
if and only if it is atleast possible for all of it's premises to be true, while it's confluded to be false.
if and only if the arguement is VALID, and all of it's PREMISES are TRUE.
if and only if either it is NOT VALID, or it has a FALSE PREMISES.
